lenders.name: Saloni
lenders.loan_because:
As a college student, I contribute to Kiva to help women attain financial stability in developing countries. I mitigate the risk of loans defaulting by using self-defined investment criteria including: shorter repayment terms, field partners with 4-5 star ratings, socioeconomic landscape of countries, sector of business, and smaller loan amounts. To date, I have helped 544 women thus far in 32 countries. Since high school, I have been passionate about microfinance as it creates a virtuous cycle of giving and receiving.

Updated 12/02/15.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm just a student with much more to learn.

lenders.name: Jessica
lenders.loan_because: I believe that with a little bit of help, so much can be accomplished.  I believe that if you can help someone develop the tools they need, they can become self-sufficient for the rest of their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I represent individuals and companies who are in disputes with another party

lenders.name: Ivan
lenders.loan_because: I care
lenders.occupational_info: Political Science

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because:
When I saw Hassan's profile, I was intrigued by the idea of a Jewish woodworker in the USA helping a woodworker in Lebanon to equip his shop.  We are half way around the globe from one another, yet we share so much in common.  

In this picture, I am standing in front of a case that I built for my synagogue, to hold an antique wedding canopy. 

Good luck, Hassan!
lenders.occupational_info: We make wood-veneered panels to be used by other woodworkers for homes and businesses.

lenders.name: Fabio
lenders.loan_because: I know what it's like needing money to grow your business. It can be a very difficult struggle. When I am able, I will help others.
lenders.occupational_info: I have two businesses. One does mainly garden work. The other recycles old mattresses.

lenders.name: Heal Our World Project
lenders.whereabouts: First Unitarian Church of Victoria BC
lenders.loan_because:
Each year the First Unitarian Church of Victoria chooses and funds one or two projects to help heal our world. One of the H.O.W 2009 projects is to fund 100 micro loans to women. Through the generosity of our congregation we raised enough money for 138 loans!
Want more information? unitarianflames@shaw.ca
lenders.occupational_info: Unitarians believe we are all part of an interconnected web of life so reaching out to help others will help us all.

lenders.loan_because: Micro loans are an important way to help people.

lenders.name: Ron

I also am involved in several part time positions (coaching, teaching, tutoring, front desk at a hotel, and construction on my days off... =) each of which I have chosen to be involved in for a specific reason that usually has something to do with being beneficial to my future plans or just for the enjoyment of the activity.

lenders.loan_because: A micro-loan sum can help someone attain a steady income for a long time.  Given the repayment rate, the amount that actually goes to the recipient and not to a company middleman, and the ease of the transaction means it's not hard to see this is a great idea.  Go Kiva!

lenders.name: Etherealmind
lenders.loan_because:
I want to put something back. When travellng in Africa a charity worker explained how to "Feed a man a fish and you've fed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you have fed him for life". 

This is my attempt to help people make their lives better everyday.
lenders.occupational_info: I run a website etherealmind.com, and a share of the revenue is donated to this site. I remain opposed to Kiva offering lending in the first world.

lenders.name: Edi
lenders.loan_because: Until now, no credit scheme that has touched the laborer. Banks and private-party governments are more likely to give farmers capital assistance to entrepreneurs.
lenders.occupational_info:
I am a graduate of high school in Jakarta, in 1996. When I finished school I was accepted to work in a foreign supermarket companies with a BILO. In 1998 I was hit by layoffs, the company hit by financial crisis. To maintain my life trying to become a pedicab driver, motorcycle taxi bike, bajaj driver and courier mail.
In 2000 my mother died. Finally, I returned to my hometown to be with the father who lives alone. This kampong I began to learn traditional way of farming. Until the end I tried to become farm laborers and earn Rp 7.500,-  a day. Here a lot of villages see the untapped potential, such as the utilization of agricultural production to increase income communities.
Youth in my community are more likely to seek revenue to the city by becoming a worker in a factory. So many of the abandoned agricultural land or rented to farm laborers with deposit systems. But this system is very harmful because the cost of agricultural production is currently very expensive. The most dominant is the price of fertilizer. Based on this I initiated a program but a cheap farm income doubled. This program included chicken livestock, poultry fish and vegetables. The program is inter-related, such as chicken manure fertilizer can be used as vegetables. While the vegetables are not worthy of sale could be used as fish feed ingredients. To realize the program I tried talking to some community. But all have the same constraints, ie capital. Funds collected from the farmworker is very far from expectations. Finally, I consult with the bank. The result is the bank asked me with a variety of requirements such as security, income certificate, and others. The question is whether that can be used as collateral to the bank for a low-income farm workers and have no land?. This is what prompted me to write a request for a loan to Kiva. This information can be from a student at the Institute Technology of Bandung. And to write this I am trying mentranslate language through google translate. So if there are errors in the writing of thank you beg forgiveness.

lenders.name: Sonia
lenders.occupation: Teacher/ Currently stay at home mum
lenders.loan_because: As a mother and a teacher, I have come to realise that the greatest gift you can give someone is the sense of self-empowerment. I believe in helping others to help themsleves and in turn, help those around them. In self empowerment, we can find confidence, happiness, drive and ambition to do better and be better. Something as small as lending someone $25 can change their world and the world of those around them. It's a win-win situation.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a full-time stay at home who absolutely loves and is grateful for being able to spend time with my girls.

lenders.name: Tommy
lenders.loan_because: I love entrepreneurs.
lenders.occupational_info: I make websites.

lenders.name: Patrick
lenders.loan_because: A small effort on my part could make a great deal of difference to someone else.

lenders.name: Gilda
lenders.loan_because: I need it to open a business, i am a single mother of 3 children. my youngest is 13years old who is in high school and i need to support his schooling.
lenders.occupational_info: I go to offices and sell anything that my client needs.. i offer coffee, beauty products, shoes, bags etc...

lenders.name: Alexis
lenders.loan_because: I found about Kiva and wanted to help others across the world.  I have got to a point where I have realised that earning and keeping money for myself is not very fulfilling.  I wanted to enable others to put that money to good use and do something positive and productive with it instead.
lenders.occupational_info: I am basically a lawyer, but in the area of intellectual property only.  Patent attorneys are not typical lawyers as they come from science backgrounds, for example I did Chemistry at university.  I spend my time advising clients on protections they can get for their inventions, obtaining the protection for them, and helping the inventor enforce that protection.

lenders.name: Zoe
lenders.loan_because: I want to give a mother a better opportunity to provide health and education for her children
lenders.occupational_info: Developed violence prevention/alternative education program for high school drop-outs.

lenders.name: Laylay and Keykey
lenders.loan_because: I want to teach my girls about the importance of philanthropy.
lenders.occupational_info: I have the opportunity to make change happen.

lenders.name: Kristin
lenders.loan_because: I have been to 15 different countries, and know how hard it is to get ahead.  I want to give my students the opportunity to help people, and understand what it is like in other countries.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a teacher, who teaches business, entrepreneurship, and marketing.  My family also does a non-profit (NGO), at www.littlehouseontheprairie.com

lenders.name: Kipp
lenders.loan_because: "It is every man's obligation to put back into the world at least the equivalent of what he takes out of it." - Einstein

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: Everyone needs a little help sometimes!
lenders.occupational_info: I am an Italian living in Miami in the United States.  I attribute my generosity to my Italian nationality and heritage and my family upbringing.  I am fortunate enough to be able to make money and even more fortunate to be able to give it away!

lenders.name: Charlotte
lenders.loan_because: I have had many wonderful opportunities, and I think others should have the opportunity to succeed as well.
lenders.occupational_info: I work at a Veterans hospital, providing care to brave men and women who have served in the Armed Forces of the United States.

lenders.name: sivan
lenders.loan_because: i can!
lenders.occupational_info:
Yefat Nefesh Miktzoit
Happy Hippy

lenders.name: Taylor Allis
lenders.loan_because: God has blessed me.
lenders.occupational_info: I sell computers

lenders.name: Virginia
lenders.loan_because: because I believe in helping others improve their lives.  Since my retirement I have enjoyed earning pin money through a hobby and I want to share my success with others.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: I think pretty much anyone can come up with $25 without hurting themselves financially. To be able to help other people with such a small amount of money is just wonderful! I have been encouraging myffriends and family to do so, also. If a lot of people do a little bit we can help make the world better for everyone.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a logistics company. It is kind of a travel agency for freight. I do the invoicing.

lenders.name: Zaouri
lenders.occupation: Assistant Pastor to Gospel For Africa

lenders.name: shan
lenders.loan_because: microfinance goes a long way in development and poverty alleviation
lenders.occupational_info:
im a student passionate about poverty and developmental issues, with extra interest in public policies, institutions and legal systems, and their relationship with poverty/development strategies. 
although im still a student, i hope to be able to change someone's life for the better in the future when i join the workforce.

lenders.name: Samuel
lenders.loan_because: Kiva is globalization at its best! It feels great to help someone out across the globe and it doesn't even require me to really SPEND money. I'm still a student and I'm strapped for cash but this way I can help without having to donate 120 bucks a get a complimentary DVD or something. This has a REAL effect concerning REAL people with REAL stories. I love it!
lenders.occupational_info: I teach students to prepare for the entrance exams for medical school, dental school, and optometry school. I also work to help foreign doctors prepare for their US licensure exams in the hopes of securing a residency here.

lenders.name: brian
lenders.loan_because: I want the world to be more caring
lenders.occupational_info: I take away pain and help my clients feel better about themselves

lenders.name: billie
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people who want to work..

lenders.name: Jason
lenders.loan_because: It helps keep me grounded in these tough times. Things are hard here in America but what may be a small amount of money that would do little for someone here can do lots for someone elsewhere. I may lack power but I'm not powerless. I can still make a difference.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a Flight Purser (Lead Flight Attendant). I manage inflight service on transoceanic passenger jets. I work to maintain excellent customer service to passengers and to act as a liason between the cabin crew and the pilots. I just love smiling at the passengers as they board the plane, caring for them as we fly and learning more about them and their reasons for travel.

lenders.name: Sarah
lenders.loan_because: I see so many things that need to change in the world. Too many to accomplish in my lifetime. But that won't stop me from trying. This is one small, but real way that I can help a complete stranger change their lives for the better. And I can do it over and over again on a college student's budget!
lenders.occupational_info: I study at a great school (UCSD). Hopefully everything I learn I can one day use to make a difference.

lenders.name: Kevin
lenders.loan_because: I am from a single mother who worked the soil her whole life and all she needed was a break to buy land in which to build a garden nursery in Seattle, Washington.  Being poor with no assets the banks would never take a chance despite her expert skills, loyal clients, and knowledge in Pacific Northwest landscaping and horticulture.  Hopefully, I can give someone a chance to show the world what my mom wanted to do - i.e. make a decent living and do what they love....
lenders.occupational_info: I analyze and evaulate the market value of commerical real estate for large clients in order to help them on their investment decisons.

lenders.name: RFC
lenders.occupation: Being the change I wish to see in the world
